item.title: Docker Guide for Beginners: Keywords in Docker
item.description: Docker Engine The Docker Engine is the layer on which Docker runs, and its task is to manage containers, images, building, etc. This layer sits right above the host machine’s operating system and performs its tasks by receiving commands from the client (for example, the terminal). Dockerfile A Dockerfile is where the necessary instructions for building an image are written. If you take a look at existing Dockerfiles, you will see sample commands like RUN apt-get install something; these commands allow us to install necessary packages for running software in an isolated container environment, assign ports, or define directories.
